intro: Silene heuffelii, commonly known as the Heuffel's campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Afghanistan and Pakistan. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to the harsh, arid environments it inhabits. Silene heuffelii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
